Description: A: Raised, circular limestone object with flat base, eroded on surface, from the base a short stud protrudes, made of copper, square in section, both parts are glued together, a white substance is still visible. B: Raised, circular limestone object with flat base, with a central shallow, cylindrical hole, might have been the second part of 543a forming a bobbin. C: Like 543b, but smaller in size. Raised, circular limestone object with a central shallow, cylindrical hole, a part of the original surface is preserved.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 155)
